solution_line_template: It will be 90 degrees for {temp_90_percent_text}% of the {total_weeks} weeks, for a total of {temp_90_percent_decimal}*{total_weeks}={weeks_at_90_deg} weeks.
It will be 100 degrees F for the remainder of the {total_weeks} weeks, or {total_weeks}-{weeks_at_90_deg}=<<{total_weeks}-{weeks_at_90_deg}={weeks_at_100_deg}>>{weeks_at_100_deg} weeks.

During the {weeks_at_90_deg} weeks when it averages 90 degrees F, he will eat {crickets_per_week_90_deg} crickets per week for a total of {weeks_at_90_deg}*{crickets_per_week_90_deg}=<<{weeks_at_90_deg}*{crickets_per_week_90_deg}={crickets_90_deg_total}>>{crickets_90_deg_total} crickets.

When it averages 100 degrees F, he eats twice as many crickets per week as when it averages 90 degrees F per week, for a total of {twice_factor}*{crickets_per_week_90_deg}={crickets_per_week_100_deg} crickets per week.

During these {weeks_at_100_deg} weeks, he will eat {crickets_per_week_100_deg}*{weeks_at_100_deg}=<<{crickets_per_week_100_deg}*{weeks_at_100_deg}={crickets_100_deg_total}>>{crickets_100_deg_total} crickets.

Therefore, over the {total_weeks} weeks, he will eat a total of {crickets_90_deg_total}+{crickets_100_deg_total}=<<{crickets_90_deg_total}+{crickets_100_deg_total}={total_crickets}>>{total_crickets} crickets.
